title: Isaiah Graham chosen as All-American
text:
Isaiah Graham chosen as All-American Bastrop wide receiver leads area in receiving yards for second straight season. Post to Facebook Isaiah Graham chosen as All-American Bastrop wide receiver leads area in receiving yards for second straight season. Join the Conversation Cody Futrell, cfutrell@thenewsstar.com 3:50 p.m. CDT October 22, 2015 Bastrop senior wide receiver Isaiah Graham and Bastrop Rams coach Brad Bradshaw after Graham received his Semper Fidelis All-American Bowl game jersey at the field house at Bastrop High School. (Photo: THE NEWS-STAR) 3 CONNECT 13 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Bastrop senior wide receiver Isaiah Graham saw another lifelong dream come true Thursday when he was officially named a part of the 2015 Semper Fidelis All-American Bowl. 
Some of the top high school football seniors each year are selected for the bowl game and Graham is one of those. 
Graham, surrounded by his parents, Willie and Angela, as well as other family and the entire Bastrop football team and staff gathered at the field house in the shadows of Rams Stadium Thursday afternoon for the presentation. 
“It is a big honor and a dream come true for me,” Graham said. “It is something I have been working a long time for. I just thank my family, teammates and coaches for their support.” 
The Semper Fidelis All-American Bowl will be played January 4, 2016 at StubHub Center in Carson, California. Fox Sports 1 will broadcast the game live at 8 p.m. CST. 
Graham is one of the top wide receiver talents in the state again this season. Graham has 25 receptions for 563 yards and six touchdowns through seven games this season. 
Strong family support was a key factor in Graham being able to achieve the academic and athletic success in his career, according to principal Dr. David Nordman. 
“His mom and dad are very involved in the whole process of making sure he gets his grades,” Nordman said. “They are in contact with me all the time about his work and it is the kind of involvement you look for. He is a full academic qualifier. This is positive exposure for our school. It shows what making good choices and hard work will pay off in a positive way.” 
Current New York Giants wide receiver Reuben Randle, a former LSU and Bastrop star, was the last All-American bowl participant in 2008 and Denzell Duval was chosen as a PrepStar All-American in 2011. 
He is a four-star recruit that is expected to announce his college choice next Friday during a ceremony at the school. 
Graham said he has narrowed his list of five top schools to three now including Tennessee, Texas Christian and Arkansas. Graham had also previously listed Miami (Florida) and South Carolina. Graham said the recent resignation of head coach Steve Spurrier at South Carolina affected his chances of playing for the Gamecocks. 
“With the coaching staff uncertain there, it made me not want to make a move like that,” Graham said.
